DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today How Much Bothered by Feeling Like Could Vomit 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how much feeling like they could vomit (or could throw up) bothered them or troubled them yesterday or today, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today How Much Bothered by Feeling Like Could Vomit Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version._The time period consisting of the current day and the preceding day._A question about how much feeling like vomiting or throwing up bothered or troubled an individual._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-10) How Bothered or Troubled 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Not at all) to 4 (Very much) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-12) questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was of a moderate amount, intensity, or duration.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was of a moderate amount, intensity, or duration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How much did this feeling bot
ReferenceDocuments.description: How much did this feeling bother you or trouble you?
